facts.1: Belarus Independence Day is a public holiday in Belarus, celebrating the liberation of Minsk from Nazi occupation in 1944.
facts.2: The date is also officially known as the day of the Republic of Belarus.
facts.3: The main events are usually a military parade and fireworks in the capital, Minsk.

Day 2.title: The start of the Battle of Gettysburg

facts.1: The Battle of Gettysburg was a turning point in the American Civil War. It began on July 3, 1863.
facts.2: It is known for being the battle with the largest number of casualties in the Civil War and is often described as the war's turning point.
facts.3: Gettysburg is also renowned for President Abraham Lincoln's famous Gettysburg Address, delivered four and a half months after the battle.

facts.1: National Fried Clam Week is an informal food holiday celebrated in the United States on July 3rd.
facts.2: The holiday commemorates the moment when Lawrence Henry "Chubby" Woodman fried the first clams in Essex, Massachusetts, in 1916.
facts.3: Clam shacks and seafood restaurants often have special offers on this day.
